name: Christmas Breakfast Sausage Casserole
author: M.K. Meredith
summary: My mom has always made this for us on Christmas morning, and since we only have it once a year it makes it even more good. It is so delicious, and everyone enjoys it! When I double the recipe I use 1 pound regular sausage and 1 pound sage sausage.
ingredients: 6 slices white bread, toasted and cut into cubes
directions: Crumble sausage into a medium skillet
Cook over medium heat until evenly brown; drain
In a medium bowl, mix together mustard powder, salt, eggs and milk
Add the sausage, bread cubes, and cheese, and stir to coat evenly
Pour into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish
Cover, and chill in the refrigerator for 8 hours, or overnight
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Uncover, and reduce temperature to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)
Bake for an additional 30 minutes, or until set
